volumePathBuilder.syncDescription: Enable this if you want your data to stay synchronized across multiple app instances running on different Flux nodes.
volumePathBuilder.syncEnabledHint: Your data will be synced across all instances
volumePathBuilder.syncDisabledHint: Each instance will have their persistent data
volumePathBuilder.modePhasedMasterMasterDesc: All instances can read and write, with controlled phased synchronization
volumePathBuilder.modePrimaryStandbyDesc: One primary instance handles writes, others are read-only backups
volumePathBuilder.modeMasterMasterDesc: All instances can read and write simultaneously
volumePathBuilder.validationBaseCannotBeMount: Base entry cannot be a mount
volumePathBuilder.validationSyncMustBeSubpath: Sync path must be subpath of base ({basePath})
volumePathBuilder.validationFilenameRequired: Filename is required for file mounts
volumePathBuilder.validationFilePathMustHaveFilename: File mount path must include a filename (e.g., /etc/config.yaml, not just /etc)
volumePathBuilder.validationFilePathShouldHaveExtension: File mount path should include a filename with extension (e.g., /etc/config.yaml)
volumePathBuilder.validationComponentMountRequiresNumber: Component mount types require a component number in Mode
volumePathBuilder.validationPathContainsColon: Remove : from path - use a different path name
volumePathBuilder.validationPathContainsPipe: Remove | from path - use a different path name
volumePathBuilder.validationFilenameContainsColon: Remove : from filename - use a different name
volumePathBuilder.validationFilenameContainsPipe: Remove | from filename - use a different name
volumePathBuilder.validationModeConflictsWithPrefix: Choose a different Mode - m, f, c, cf are not allowed
volumePathBuilder.typePrimaryDesc: Main persistent storage for your application
volumePathBuilder.typeDirectoryDesc: Mount a specific host folder to container path
volumePathBuilder.typeFileDesc: Mount a specific host file to container path
volumePathBuilder.typeComponentPrimaryDesc: Reference primary storage from another component
volumePathBuilder.typeComponentDirectoryDesc: Reference a directory from another component
volumePathBuilder.typeComponentFileDesc: Reference a file from another component
volumePathBuilder.modeTooltip: Use component number to mount data from another component (e.g., 0, 1, 2).
volumePathBuilder.typeTooltip: What to mount: Primary (main folder), Directory/File (additional storage), Component (share with another app)
volumePathBuilder.validationReservedSubdir: Subdirectory name is reserved (cannot use: appdata, backup, ., ..)
volumePathBuilder.validationContainerDataTooLong: Total mount configuration is too long ({current} chars, max {max}) - reduce number of mounts or use shorter names/paths
volumePathBuilder.validationOnlyFirstCanBePrimary: Only the first mount can be Primary type - change Type to Directory, File, or Component
volumePathBuilder.mountTypePrimaryDesc: Main volume mount using the component's appdata directory. This is always the first entry. Can optionally use sync modes (r, g, s). Example: /data or r:/data
volumePathBuilder.mountTypeDirectoryDesc: Additional directory mount as a sibling to appdata. Requires a subdirectory name. Useful for separating logs, cache, or backups. Example: Subdir='logs', Path='/var/log' creates /apps/component/logs/
volumePathBuilder.mountTypeFileDesc: Individual file mount as a sibling to appdata. Requires a filename. Useful for config files that persist across updates. Example: Filename='config.yaml', Path='/etc/app/config.yaml'
volumePathBuilder.mountTypeComponentPrimaryDesc: Mounts the entire appdata directory from another component. Select the component number in Mode. Useful for sharing all data between components. Example: Mode='0:', Path='/shared-data'
volumePathBuilder.mountTypeComponentDirectoryDesc: Mounts a specific subdirectory from another component. Select component in Mode, specify the subdirectory name. Example: Mode='0:', Subdir='backups', Path='/restore-from'
volumePathBuilder.mountTypeComponentFileDesc: Mounts a specific file from another component. Select component in Mode, specify the filename. Example: Mode='0:', Filename='cert.pem', Path='/etc/ssl/cert.pem'
volumePathBuilder.syncModesMasterMasterDesc: Full real-time two-way sync between all participants. Changes on any side are propagated to all others immediately.
volumePathBuilder.syncModesPhasedMasterMasterDesc: Two-way sync between all participants where syncing occurs in controlled phases during startup. The r mode prevents overwriting of existing data when a new instance is started.
volumePathBuilder.syncModesPrimaryStandbyDesc: One-way sync from primary to standby. The base component is the source of truth, and others receive updates but do not modify the data.
volumePathBuilder.exampleMixedDesc: Data synced with additional cache directory and settings file
volumePathBuilder.ruleBaseCannotBeMount: First entry must be Primary type (cannot reference another component)
volumePathBuilder.ruleOnlyOneSyncMode: Only one sync mode (r/g/s) allowed per component
volumePathBuilder.ruleAllSyncPathsWithinBase: When using sync modes, all paths must be within the primary path hierarchy
volumePathBuilder.ruleSyncFoldersSharedParent: All sync folders must share the same parent directory
volumePathBuilder.ruleSameComponentRemounts: Component references can point to the same component or earlier components
volumePathBuilder.ruleOtherMountsReferPrevious: Component references cannot point to future components (e.g., component 1 cannot reference component 2)
volumePathBuilder.ruleNoDuplicatePaths: Each container path must be unique (no duplicates)
volumePathBuilder.ruleSubdirsUnique: Each subdirectory/filename must be unique within the component
volumePathBuilder.ruleAllPathsStartSlash: All container paths must start with / and cannot contain invalid characters

whatIsFlux.question: What is FluxCloud?
whatIsFlux.answer: FluxCloud is a decentralized cloud computing platform powered by Web3 technology. Unlike traditional cloud providers that rely on centralized data centers, FluxCloud distributes your applications across {nodeCount}+ independently operated nodes in {countryCount}+ countries. This provides better redundancy, censorship resistance, and significantly lower costs.

howToDeploy.question: How do I deploy an application?
howToDeploy.answer:
Deploying on FluxCloud is simple:
  1. Click "Start Deploying" to access the configuration page
  2. Specify your Docker image and configuration
  3. Choose your resources (CPU, RAM, storage)
  4. Select number of instances and deployment locations
  5. Deploy and your app will be live in minutes

We support Docker images from any registry including Docker Hub, GitHub Container Registry, and private registries.

pricing.question: How much does it cost?
pricing.answer:
FluxCloud offers transparent, pay-as-you-go pricing starting at just $0.99/month for basic configurations. Pricing depends on:
  • CPU cores allocated
  • RAM amount
  • Storage size
  • Number of instances
  • Port requirements

Use our Cost Calculator to estimate exact pricing for your needs. No hidden fees, no surprise charges.

support.question: What kind of support is available?
support.answer:
We offer multiple support channels:
  • Documentation: Comprehensive guides at docs.runonflux.io
  • Discord Community: Active 24/7 community support
  • Email Support: Direct assistance from our team
  • Ticketing System: Track issues at support.runonflux.io
  • AI Assistant: Built-in AI helper for quick questions

requirements.question: What are the requirements to deploy?
requirements.answer:
To deploy applications on FluxCloud you need:
  • A Flux ID: Create one for free using any Flux-compatible wallet
  • Docker Image: Your application packaged as a Docker container
  • FLUX tokens or USD: To pay for hosting (we accept credit cards via Stripe and PayPal)
  • Minimum 3 instances: For decentralization and redundancy

Minimum resources per instance: 0.1 CPU cores, 100 MB RAM, 1 GB storage

security.question: How secure is FluxCloud?
security.answer:
FluxCloud implements multiple security layers:
  • Container Isolation: Each app runs in its own isolated Docker container
  • Encrypted Transfer: All data in transit is encrypted
  • DDoS Protection: Built-in protection against attacks
  • Regular Audits: Code and infrastructure regularly audited
  • Decentralized: No single point of failure
  • Private Options: Enterprise mode for enhanced privacy

You maintain full control over your application code and data.

help.changeSpecsQuestion: Can I change specifications after deployment?
help.changeSpecsAnswer: Yes, you can update your application specifications at any time. Changes will be applied during the next renewal period or through a manual redeployment.

help.syncDataAnswer: Data sync enables sharing storage across instances using Master-Master (r) or Master-Slave (g) modes. When disabled, each instance uses isolated persistent storage.

pricing.question: How much does it cost to host an application on Flux?
pricing.answer: Hosting on Flux starts at just $0.99/month. Final pricing depends on your resource requirements (CPU, RAM, storage) and the number of instances. Use our cost calculator above to get an exact price for your specific needs. We offer transparent, pay-as-you-go pricing with no hidden fees or long-term contracts.

comparison.question: How does Flux pricing compare to traditional cloud providers?
comparison.answer: Flux typically costs 50-80% less than traditional cloud providers like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure. Our decentralized network eliminates middlemen and passes the savings to you. For example, hosting a basic web app that costs $50/month on AWS typically costs around $10-15/month on Flux.

paymentMethods.question: What payment methods does Flux accept?
paymentMethods.answer: Flux accepts FLUX cryptocurrency (native FLUX coins on the main chain) as well as traditional payment methods through our integrated payment gateways. You can pay month-to-month with no long-term commitment required.

hiddenFees.question: Are there any hidden fees or additional costs?
hiddenFees.answer: No. The price calculated in our cost calculator is the exact amount you pay. There are no setup fees, no hidden bandwidth charges, and no surprise bills. All costs are transparent and included in the monthly price shown.

planChanges.question: Can I change my hosting plan after deployment?
planChanges.answer: Yes! Flux offers flexible scaling. You can easily upgrade or downgrade your CPU, RAM, and storage at any time. Simply adjust your specifications and the pricing will update accordingly. Changes take effect immediately, and you only pay for what you use.

resourceExceeded.question: What happens if my app exceeds the allocated resources?
resourceExceeded.answer: Your application will be throttled to prevent it from using more resources than allocated. This protects other users on the network. If you need more resources, you can easily upgrade your plan through the Flux dashboard. We recommend monitoring your app usage and adjusting resources proactively.

genericFAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
genericFAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about hosting on Flux Cloud

questions.q: What is Flux Cloud?
questions.a: Flux Cloud is a decentralized cloud computing platform powered by Web3 technology. It provides secure, scalable, and cost-effective hosting for applications, games, and services across a global network of nodes.

questions.q: How do I get started?
questions.a: Simply browse the marketplace, select your desired application or game, choose your configuration, and deploy. Your instance will be live within minutes. No complex setup required!

questions.q: What payment methods do you accept?
questions.a: We accept FLUX tokens, as well traditional payment methods through our integrated payment processors (Stripe and Paypal).

questions.q: Can I upgrade or downgrade my plan?
questions.a: Yes! You can easily scale your resources up or down at any time through your dashboard. Changes take effect immediately with no downtime.

questions.q: What happens if I need more resources?
questions.a: You can instantly upgrade to a higher tier configuration at any time. Simply select the new configuration in your dashboard and the changes will be applied automatically.

questions.q: How is uptime guaranteed?
questions.a: Our decentralized architecture distributes your application across multiple nodes, ensuring 99.9% uptime. If one node experiences issues, your application automatically fails over to healthy nodes.

questions.q: Can I cancel anytime?
questions.a: Yes, there are no long-term contracts or cancellation fees. You can cancel your subscription at any time ask for a refund in the first 30 days.

questions.q: Do you offer backups?
questions.a: Yes, automatic backups are included with all apps that have decentralized persistent data. Your data is weekly backed up and can be restored at any time through your dashboard.

questions.q: What kind of support is available?
questions.a: We offer 24/7 support through our Discord community, email support, our AI built-in tool, and our support ticket system at support.runonflux.io.

appSpecificFAQ.pricingQuestion: How much does it cost to host {appName} on Flux Cloud?

This includes decentralized infrastructure across a global network of nodes, automatic backups, built-in DDoS protection, 99.9% uptime guarantee, and 24/7 support. You can scale resources up or down anytime with our flexible pricing options. No hidden fees or long-term contracts required.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about hosting Minecraft on FluxCloud

questions.q: How do I host a Minecraft server on FluxCloud?
questions.a: Select your preferred server configuration based on player count, click "Install," and follow our simple deployment wizard. Your server will be live within minutes!

questions.q: How much does Minecraft hosting cost?
questions.a: Plans start at [[minPrice]]/month and scale based on RAM, CPU, and player capacity. All plans include DDoS protection and automatic backups.

questions.q: Can I install mods and plugins?
questions.a: Yes! Full support for Bukkit, Spigot, Paper, Forge, Fabric, and all major mod loaders. Upload and configure custom plugins and modpacks via SSH to your game server or using the Volume Browser functionality in application management.

questions.q: What Minecraft versions are supported?
questions.a: All Minecraft Java Edition versions from 1.8 to the latest release. Switch versions anytime via SSH or the Volume Browser in application management.

questions.q: How do backups work?
questions.a: Automatic weekly backups are created and maintained while your app is active. The latest backup is always preserved until app expiration. You can also create manual backups anytime and restore with one click.

questions.q: Can I transfer my existing Minecraft world?
questions.a: Absolutely! Upload your existing world files via SSH to your game server or using the Volume Browser functionality in application management. We also offer free migration assistance for servers hosted elsewhere.

gettingStarted.title: How to Get Started with Minecraft Server Hosting
gettingStarted.subtitle: Launch your Minecraft server in 3 easy steps

steps.title: Choose Your Configuration
steps.description: Select the RAM, CPU, and storage based on your expected player count. We offer configurations from small private servers (5-10 players) to large multiplayer networks (100+ players).

steps.title: Deploy Your Server
steps.description: Click the deploy button and our automated system will provision your Minecraft server across the Flux decentralized network. Your server will be ready in under 5 minutes with the latest Minecraft version.

steps.title: Customize and Play
steps.description: Access your server via SSH or the Volume Browser to install mods, configure settings, and upload custom worlds. Share your server IP with friends and start playing immediately!

Perfect for engineering enthusiasts, automation lovers, and teams looking to build the ultimate factory. From modest beginnings to launching rockets, your factory's success depends on reliable hosting.

description.title: About Satisfactory Server Hosting
description.content:
Satisfactory is a first-person open-world factory building game with a dash of exploration and combat. Explore an alien planet, harvest resources, and construct massive automated factories in stunning 3D environments.

Host your dedicated Satisfactory server on Flux for smooth cooperative gameplay with up to 4 players. Build mega-factories together, explore dangerous biomes, and automate production chains on a reliable, high-performance infrastructure. Satisfactory server hosting starts at [[minPrice]]/month with the power to handle even the most complex mega-factories.

From humble beginnings with basic conveyors to sprawling multi-level factories with trains, drones, and hypertubes - your industrial empire needs rock-solid hosting to handle the complexity.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about hosting Satisfactory on FluxCloud

questions.q: How do I host a Satisfactory server on FluxCloud?
questions.a: Select your server plan, click "Install," and deploy within minutes. Load your existing save or start fresh. Your factory will be online and ready for co-op building!

questions.q: How much does Satisfactory hosting cost?
questions.a: Plans start at [[minPrice]]/month for standard servers and scale up to handle even the most complex mega-factories. DDoS protection and backups included.

questions.q: Can I use mods on my server?
questions.a: Yes! Full support for Satisfactory Mod Manager (SMM) mods. Upload and configure mods via SSH to your game server or using the Volume Browser functionality in application management. Popular mods like Refined Power, Smart!, and MAM Enhancer work perfectly. All players need matching mods installed.

questions.q: What are the server requirements?
questions.a: Minimum: 4GB RAM for starter factories. Recommended: 8GB RAM for mid-game. Advanced: 16GB RAM for massive late-game factories with trains and drones. CPU scales with factory complexity.

questions.q: How do save files work?
questions.a: Automatic weekly backups are created and maintained while your app is active. The latest backup is always preserved until app expiration. You can also create manual backups anytime. Download saves to play offline or transfer between servers.

questions.q: Can I transfer my single-player save?
questions.a: Absolutely! Upload your single-player save file via SSH to your game server or using the Volume Browser functionality in application management. Continue your factory with friends exactly where you left off, with all buildings and progress intact.

description.title: About Enshrouded Server Hosting
description.content:
Enshrouded is a survival action RPG where you can play solo or with up to 16 players in co-op mode. Explore the vast voxel-based world of Embervale, battle fierce enemies, craft powerful equipment, and build epic bases with your friends.

Run your own Enshrouded server on Flux for an immersive co-op experience. Venture into the deadly Shroud, uncover ancient secrets, build magnificent structures, and survive together in this beautiful yet dangerous world. Enshrouded server hosting starts at [[minPrice]]/month with support for up to 16 players.

Whether you're focused on combat, building, exploration, or crafting, hosting on Flux ensures your adventures are smooth, persistent, and always available for your entire party.

content.title: Professional Game Server Hosting Made Simple
content.body:
FluxPlay revolutionizes game server hosting by combining the power of decentralized infrastructure with the simplicity of traditional hosting. Whether you're hosting Minecraft, Palworld, Factorio, Satisfactory, or Enshrouded servers, our platform delivers unmatched performance and reliability.

Built on FluxCloud, FluxPlay provides enterprise-grade game hosting with automatic scaling, geographic distribution, and military-grade security. Our decentralized architecture ensures your game server remains online even if individual nodes fail, providing superior uptime compared to traditional centralized hosting providers.

With instant deployment, transparent pricing, and included DDoS protection, FluxPlay is the modern solution for gamers, communities, and server administrators who demand the best.

index.gamesSubtitle: Choose your game and deploy a server in seconds

what.question: What is FluxPlay game server hosting?
what.answer: FluxPlay is a decentralized game server hosting platform built on FluxCloud. It allows you to deploy and manage game servers like Minecraft, Palworld, Factorio, and more with instant deployment, global distribution, and enterprise-grade security.

different.question: How is FluxPlay different from traditional game hosting?
different.answer: FluxPlay uses decentralized blockchain infrastructure instead of centralized data centers. This provides superior uptime, transparent pricing, included DDoS protection, and resistance to single points of failure. You can deploy servers in under 30 seconds compared to hours or days with traditional providers.

games.question: What games can I host on FluxPlay?
games.answer: FluxPlay currently supports popular games including Minecraft, Palworld, Factorio, Satisfactory, and Enshrouded. We're constantly adding new games based on community demand.

deploy.question: How quickly can I deploy a game server?
deploy.answer: Game servers deploy in under 30 seconds on average. Simply select your game, choose your configuration and server location, and click deploy. Our automated system handles all the technical setup for you.

ddosProtection.question: Is DDoS protection included?
ddosProtection.answer: Yes! Enterprise-grade DDoS protection is included with all game servers at no extra cost. Your server is protected against common attack vectors, ensuring your players stay connected even during attacks.

pricing.question: How does pricing work?
pricing.answer: FluxPlay uses transparent pay-as-you-go pricing. You only pay for the computing resources (CPU, RAM, storage) your server uses. No hidden fees, setup costs, or long-term contracts. Pricing varies by game and configuration, typically starting around $10-15/month for small servers.

support.question: What support is available?
support.answer: All FluxPlay servers include 24/7 automated monitoring with real-time alerts. For technical support, you can access our documentation, community forums, and ticketing system. Premium support packages are available for enterprise customers.

blockchain.question: Do I need cryptocurrency to use FluxPlay?
blockchain.answer: While FluxPlay is built on blockchain technology, you can pay with traditional payment methods including credit cards. The blockchain infrastructure provides security and decentralization benefits behind the scenes without requiring you to manage cryptocurrency.
